criterion.title: Organic Benefit Card Shapes (Premium Visual Pattern)
criterion.description: Implement organic shape variants for benefit cards using OrganicCard component from Epic 2. Use shape variant: "organic" for all 6 benefit cards (3 agencies + 3 brands). Each card has subtle morphing/breathing animation: Shape varies ±3-5% over 8s loop, Framer Motion path morphing (not GSAP MorphSVG), Low CPU cost, medium GPU cost (acceptable for 6 cards). Cards have glassmorphism background with accent glow: Agencies cards cyan glow (briefingPalette.cyan.DEFAULT), Brands cards fuchsia glow (briefingPalette.fuchsia.DEFAULT), Glow opacity 10-15% for subtlety.

criterion.title: 3D Y-Axis Rotation Reveal Animation (Premium Choreography)
criterion.description: Implement 3D rotation reveal for benefit cards on scroll into view. GSAP ScrollTrigger configuration: Trigger `.value-props-container`, Start `top 75%`, Initial state `rotationY: 90, opacity: 0` (cards rotated away), Final state `rotationY: 0, opacity: 1` (cards face user), Easing CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.organic (power4.out fallback), Stagger 0.15s between cards (agencies 1-3, then brands 1-3), Duration 0.8s per card, transformPerspective 1000. Stagger order: Agencies benefit 1 → 2 → 3, then Brands benefit 1 → 2 → 3 (total 6 cards).

criterion.title: Cursor-Following Gradient Spotlight (Premium Micro-Interaction)
criterion.description: Implement gradient spotlight effect that follows cursor position across value props section. Use CSS radial-gradient overlay with JavaScript mousemove tracking: Spotlight center follows cursor coordinates, Gradient radial-gradient(circle 600px at [cursorX] [cursorY], rgba(cyan/fuchsia, 0.15), transparent 70%), Throttled to 60fps (16ms mousemove event processing via gsap.utils.throttle), Spotlight color interpolates between cyan and fuchsia based on cursor X position (Left side agencies: cyan spotlight, Right side brands: fuchsia spotlight, Center: gradient blend). Spotlight effect only active on desktop (>= 1024px), disabled on mobile/tablet.
criterion.traceTo: Premium execution pattern (not explicit AC, but enhances "premium feel")

criterion.title: Dual-Button Magnetic Pull with Competing Forces (Premium Micro-Pattern)
criterion.description: Implement magnetic pull on BOTH CTA buttons using useMagneticPull hook from Epic 2. Primary Button Magnetic Config: Strength 0.4 (stronger pull), Max distance 150px cursor detection radius, Element moves ≤35px toward cursor when hovering nearby, Rotation enabled rotationIntensity 0.15 (slight tilt toward cursor). Secondary Button Magnetic Config: Strength 0.25 (gentler pull), Max distance 120px cursor detection radius, Element moves ≤25px toward cursor, Rotation enabled rotationIntensity 0.1. Competing Forces Effect: When cursor is between both buttons (equidistant), both buttons pull simultaneously, Creates visual "tension" where buttons move toward each other slightly, Throttled to 60fps for both buttons (shared mousemove listener). Magnetic pull disabled on mobile (<768px), buttons static with standard hover states.

criterion.title: Feature Pills Morphing Entrance Animation (Premium Micro-Choreography)
criterion.description: Implement morphing entrance for 3 feature pills below CTA buttons. Pills start as collapsed circles (0% width pill shape), morph into full pill capsules. GSAP animation sequence: Initial state scaleX: 0.2, opacity: 0 (pill appears as dot), Final state scaleX: 1, opacity: 1 (pill expands to full capsule width), Easing CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.spring (elastic.out for visible bounce), Stagger 0.1s between pills (sequential reveal), Duration 0.6s per pill, ScrollTrigger pills animate when CTA section scrolls into view (trigger `.cta-section`, start `top 80%`). Pills have glassmorphism styling: Background indigo gradient 15% opacity, Border 1px solid cyan/fuchsia (alternating colors), Icon + text layout.

criterion.title: Responsive Design & Performance

Mobile (375px-767px): 1 column stack (Agencies above Brands), static cards (simple fade-in), no spotlight, no magnetic pull, pills fade in. All animations achieve 60fps on Chrome 100+, Firefox 100+, Safari 15+. 3D rotation uses CSS transform + transformPerspective (GPU-accelerated). Cursor spotlight uses CSS radial-gradient (no canvas, performant).

entry.title: Epic 2 Premium Components - Usage Guide
entry.section: OrganicCard Component (lines 47-140), useMagneticPull Hook (lines 142-209), Signature Easing Curves (lines 355-391), Performance Budget (lines 393-422)
entry.snippet: Complete usage guide for Epic 2 foundation components. OrganicCard with 4 shape variants (blob, hexagon, organic, floating) and optional morphing/glow. useMagneticPull hook for cursor-following magnetic effect (throttled 60fps, auto-disables on mobile). CRE8TIVE_EASINGS signature curves (organic, smooth, spring, cinematic). Performance constraints: max 3 morphing shapes, 3 glow filters, 12 elements per timeline.
entry.reason: Integration patterns and best practices for using Epic 2 premium components in Story 2.7

OrganicCard component with shape="organic" variant will be used for all 6 benefit cards in ValuePropsAgenciesBrands. Supports morphing animation (±3-5% over 8s loop) and glow effects (cyan for agencies, fuchsia for brands). Critical dependency for AC-2.

useMagneticPull hook will be applied to BOTH CTA buttons (primary strength 0.4, secondary strength 0.25) to create competing magnetic forces effect. Throttled to 60fps, auto-disables on mobile <768px. Critical dependency for AC-6.

CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.organic (power4.out fallback) will be used for 3D Y-axis rotation reveals on benefit cards. CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.spring (elastic.out) will be used for feature pill morphing entrances. Signature curves ensure premium feel. Critical dependency for AC-3, AC-7.

briefingPalette.cyan.DEFAULT will be used for Agencies column accent color (glow, borders, headers). briefingPalette.fuchsia.DEFAULT will be used for Brands column accent color. briefingPalette.indigo.DEFAULT for CTA gradient and feature pill backgrounds. Critical dependency for AC-1, AC-2, AC-5.

interface.name: OrganicCard Component API (Epic 2 Foundation)
interface.signature: OrganicCard({ children: React.ReactNode, shape?: 'blob' | 'hexagon' | 'organic' | 'floating', // Story 2.7 uses 'organic' glowColor?: string, // briefingPalette.cyan.DEFAULT or .fuchsia.DEFAULT morphing?: boolean, // true for breathing animation morphIntensity?: number, // 0.03-0.05 (±3-5% variance) className?: string }): JSX.Element
interface.reason: OrganicCard will wrap all 6 benefit cards in ValuePropsAgenciesBrands. Use shape="organic" for softer edges (better for text-heavy cards), morphing=true for subtle breathing (±3-5% over 8s loop), glowColor for cyan/fuchsia accent glow (10-15% opacity).

interface.name: useMagneticPull Hook API (Epic 2 Foundation)
interface.signature: useMagneticPull({ strength?: number, // 0-1, pull intensity (primary: 0.4, secondary: 0.25) maxDistance?: number, // Max pixels element can move (primary: 150px, secondary: 120px) ease?: string, // GSAP easing (default: 'power2.out') rotation?: boolean, // Enable rotation on pull (true) rotationIntensity?: number // 0-1, rotation amount (primary: 0.15, secondary: 0.1) }): React.RefObject<HTMLDivElement>
interface.reason: useMagneticPull will be applied to BOTH CTA buttons (primary and secondary) to create competing magnetic forces effect. Primary button gets stronger pull (0.4 strength, 150px radius), secondary gets gentler pull (0.25 strength, 120px radius). When cursor is equidistant, both buttons pull simultaneously (visual tension).

interface.name: CRE8TIVE_EASINGS Constants (Epic 2 Foundation)
interface.reason: CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.organic will be used for 3D Y-axis rotation reveals on benefit cards (smooth deceleration). CRE8TIVE_EASINGS.spring will be used for feature pill morphing entrances (visible bounce with elastic.out). Signature curves ensure premium feel across all animations.
